oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soldiers; Military uniforms
United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Gist, States Rights (1831- )
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Half-length portrait of Confederate Colonel States Rights Gist (1831-1864) seated in military uniform.

States Rights Gist was an active secessionist from South Carolina who achieved the rank of brigadier general in the state militia. In 1862 he was commissioned a brigadier general in the Confederate army and served at Vicksburg. He also served at Chickamauga, Chattanooga, and Atlanta. He was shot and killed during the Battle of Franklin in 1864.
